column4: anyone knows if there is a way to create a list of the packages I have installed so I can diff them after upgrade?

I just changed my sources.list to breezy sources and went apt-get update; apt-get dist-upgrade. it finished download all the packeges and now its selecting and unpacking them. while it does, I see all sorts of error messages like unable to delete directory or stuff about the locals. should I be worried? Where can I see a log of those errors later?
no you should not be worried
make sure your interface is set to auto and dhcp in the interfaces file

Earlier you told me not to only compile kernel the way ubuntu wiki explain. what's wrong with the old fashion way? if I need 2.6.14, can I use apt-get to get the source and then patch it from kernel.org?
cause I have an operation systems project from my university and it was decided that that's the kernel version we'll use...
I didn't understand that answer: "right...". do you think I'm kidding you?
oh... well, it's not a requirement, we're a group of 3 students and we were told to pick what we want. any erason why not to use .14?
ubing a standard kernel is easier :)
